meanings.definition: To cause a bacteriophage to become integrated into a bacterial chromosome and replicate with it.
meanings.sent1: Scientists are lysogenizing the bacteriophage to study its behavior within the bacterial chromosome.
meanings.sent2: The researchers observed the lysogenizing process under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The bacteriophage was feeling quite adventurous, deciding to go on a journey into the bacterial chromosome through lysogenizing.
meanings.sent4: Lysogenizing is like inviting a guest to stay in your house forever, sharing your space and resources.
meanings.sent5: The concept of lysogenizing can be compared to a symbiotic relationship between the bacteriophage and the bacterial chromosome.

meanings.definition: The process of incorporating a bacteriophage into a bacterial chromosome.
meanings.sent1: The lysogenizing of the bacteriophage was a crucial step in the experiment.
meanings.sent2: Researchers studied the effects of lysogenizing on the bacterial chromosome.
meanings.sent3: The lysogenizing event at the microscopic level looked like a tiny puzzle coming together.
meanings.sent4: In nature, lysogenizing can be seen as a harmonious merging of the bacteriophage and the bacterial chromosome.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of lysogenizing lies in the seamless integration of the bacteriophage into the bacterial chromosome.
